name: Create a check run

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the check (e.g., "code-coverage").

params.name: head_branch
params.description: The name of the branch to perform a check against.

params.name: head_sha
params.description: The SHA of the commit.

params.name: details_url
params.description: The URL of the integrator's site that has the full details of the check.

params.name: external_id
params.description: A reference for the run on the integrator's system.

params.name: status
params.description: The current status. Can be one of `queued`, `in_progress`, or `completed`.

params.name: started_at
params.description: The time that the check run began in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`.

params.name: conclusion
params.description: The final conclusion of the check. Can be one of `success`, `failure`, `neutral`, `cancelled`, `timed_out`, or `action_required`. When the conclusion is `action_required`, additional details should be provided on the site specified by `details_url`. Required if you provide a `status` of `completed`.

params.name: completed_at
params.description: The time the check completed in ISO 8601 format: `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ`. Required if you provide `conclusion`.

params.name: output
params.description: Check runs can accept a variety of data in the `output` object, including a `title` and `summary` and can optionally provide descriptive details about the run. See the [`output` object](#output-object) description.

params.name: output.title
params.description: The title of the check run.

params.name: output.summary
params.description: The summary of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.

params.name: output.text
params.description: The details of the check run. This parameter supports Markdown.

params.name: output.annotations
params.description: Adds information from your analysis to specific lines of code. Annotations are visible in GitHub's pull request UI. For details about annotations in the UI, see "[About status checks](https://help.github.com/articles/about-status-checks#checks)". See the [`annotations` object](#annotations-object) description for details about how to use this parameter.

params.name: output.annotations[].filename
params.description: The name of the file to add an annotation to.

params.name: output.annotations[].blob_href
params.description: The file's full blob URL.

params.name: output.annotations[].start_line
params.description: The start line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].end_line
params.description: The end line of the annotation.

params.name: output.annotations[].warning_level
params.description: The warning level of the annotation. Can be one of `notice`, `warning`, or `failure`.

params.name: output.annotations[].message
params.description: A short description of the feedback for these lines of code. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.annotations[].title
params.description: The title that represents the annotation. The maximum size is 255 characters.

params.name: output.annotations[].raw_details
params.description: Details about this annotation. The maximum size is 64 KB.

params.name: output.images
params.description: Adds images to the output displayed in the GitHub pull request UI. See the [`images` object](#images-object) description for details.

params.name: output.images[].alt
params.description: The alternative text for the image.

params.name: output.images[].image_url
params.description: The full URL of the image.

params.name: output.images[].caption
params.description: A short image description.

description: Creates a new check run for a specific commit in a repository. Your GitHub App must have the `checks:write` permission to create check runs.
